intro: Argostemma distichum subsp. quadripetalum, commonly known as the four-petaled argostemma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that typically have four petals, giving it its specific epithet "quadripetalum." The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal species. It grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface.
